thread.title: 'Doctor Strange' comes to digital, Blu-ray in February
thread.title_full: 'Doctor Strange' comes to digital, Blu-ray in February

author: Brian Truitt, USA TODAY
title: 'Doctor Strange' comes to digital, Blu-ray in February
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 'Doctor Strange' comes to digital, Blu-ray in February Brian Truitt , USA TODAY 9:05   Share Benedict Cumberbatch, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Tilda Swinton star in the Marvel movie 'Doctor Strange.' Marvel 'Doctor Strange,' starring Benedict Cumberbatch as sorcerer Stephen Strange, debuts on digital HD Feb. 14 and Blu-ray Feb. 28. (Photo: Marvel) 30 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Superhero fans are about to have a magical Valentine’s Day. 
The Marvel Studios hit Doctor Strange , starring Benedict Cumberbatch as surgeon-turned-sorcerer Stephen Strange, will debut on digital HD platforms (including iTunes and Disney Movies Anywhere) Feb. 14 and on Blu-ray 3D, Blu-ray, DVD and on-demand Feb. 28. 
Doctor Strange, which had a domestic haul of $231 million ($658 million worldwide), was nominated for six Critics' Choice Awards — including individual nods for Cumberbatch and Tilda Swinton (who plays the Ancient One) — and is one of 10 films in the running for a visual-effects Oscar nomination. 
Concept art of Doctor Strange and the Crimson Bands of Cyttorak by Tim Hill. (Photo: Marvel) 
The Blu-ray and digital releases include five behind-the-scenes featurettes, including looks at costumes, set design, fight choreography and Michael Giacchino’s original score. Also on tap: a gag reel, audio commentary by director Scott Derrickson and five deleted scenes — one features Mads Mikkelsen’s villain Kaecilius and another has Strange meeting Daniel Drumm (Mark Anthony Bryant), a character with strong ties to comic-book lore. 
In addition, the Doctor Strange release offers a bunch of extras that tie into the bigger Marvel Cinematic Universe. A digital-exclusive featurette explores how Marvel grounds its films in real science, there’s a “Phase 3” sneak peek at upcoming films including Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 , Thor: Ragnarok , Black Panther and Avengers: Infinity War , and a mockumentary short continuing the misadventures of Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and his Australian roommate Darryl (Daley Pearson). 30 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2i0abEW NEVER MISS OUT Life Be a pop culture maven.
